    FEE_PER_BYTE_CHUNK_SIZE
    Fee per byte is rounded up in chunks.
    static final long
    INTEGRATED_ADDRESS_LENGTH
    The length of an integrated address for Kryptokrona - It's the same as a normal address, but there is a paymentID included in there - since payment ID's are 64 chars, and base58 encoding is done by encoding chunks of 8 chars at once into blocks of 11 chars, we can calculate this automatically.
    static final long
    LOCKED_TRANSACTIONS_CHECK_INTERVAL
    How often to check on locked transactions.
    static final long
    MAX_LAST_FETCHED_BLOCK_INTERVAL
    The amount of seconds to permit not having fetched a block from the daemon before emitting 'deadnode'.
    static final long
    MAX_LAST_UPDATED_LOCAL_HEIGHT_INTERVAL
    The amount of seconds to permit not having fetched a new local height from the daemon before emitting 'deadnode'.
    static final long
    MAX_LAST_UPDATED_NETWORK_HEIGHT_INTERVAL
    The amount of seconds to permit not having fetched a new network height from the daemon before emitting 'deadnode'.
    static final long
    MINIMUM_FEE
    The minimum fee allowed for transactions, in ATOMIC units.
    static final double
    MINIMUM_FEE_PER_BYTE
    Fee to charge per byte of transaction.

    static final long

    static final boolean

    • BLOCKS_PER_TICK

      public static final long BLOCKS_PER_TICK
      The amount of blocks to process per 'tick' of the mainloop. Note: too high a value will cause the event loop to be blocked, and your interaction to be laggy.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

      public static final String TICKER
      Kryptokrona 'ticker'

    • SCAN_COINBASE_TRANSACTIONS

      public static final boolean SCAN_COINBASE_TRANSACTIONS
      Most people haven't mined any blocks, so lets not waste time scanning them.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • MINIMUM_FEE

      public static final long MINIMUM_FEE
      The minimum fee allowed for transactions, in ATOMIC units.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • FEE_PER_BYTE_CHUNK_SIZE

      public static final int FEE_PER_BYTE_CHUNK_SIZE
      Fee per byte is rounded up in chunks. This helps makes estimates more accurate. It's suggested to make this a power of two, to relate to the underlying storage cost / page sizes for storing a transaction.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • MINIMUM_FEE_PER_BYTE

      public static final double MINIMUM_FEE_PER_BYTE
      Fee to charge per byte of transaction. Will be applied in chunks, see above. This value comes out to 1.953125. We use this value instead of something like 2 because it makes for pretty resulting fees - 5 XKR vs 5.12 XKR. You can read this as the fee per chunk is 500 atomic units. The fee per byte is 500 / chunk size.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • MIXIN_LIMITS

      public static final MixinLimits MIXIN_LIMITS
      Mapping of height to mixin maximum and mixin minimum.

    • STANDARD_ADDRESS_LENGTH

      public static final long STANDARD_ADDRESS_LENGTH
      The length of a standard address for Kryptokrona.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • INTEGRATED_ADDRESS_LENGTH

      public static final long INTEGRATED_ADDRESS_LENGTH
      The length of an integrated address for Kryptokrona - It's the same as a normal address, but there is a paymentID included in there - since payment ID's are 64 chars, and base58 encoding is done by encoding chunks of 8 chars at once into blocks of 11 chars, we can calculate this automatically.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • BLOCK_STORE_MEMORY_LIMIT

      public static final long BLOCK_STORE_MEMORY_LIMIT
      The amount of memory to use storing downloaded blocks - 50MB
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • BLOCKS_PER_DAEMON_REQUEST

      public static final long BLOCKS_PER_DAEMON_REQUEST
      The amount of blocks to take from the daemon per request. Cannot take more than 100.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • MAX_LAST_FETCHED_BLOCK_INTERVAL

      public static final long MAX_LAST_FETCHED_BLOCK_INTERVAL
      The amount of seconds to permit not having fetched a block from the daemon before emitting 'deadnode'. Note that this just means contacting the daemon for data - if you are synced and it returns TopBlock - the event will not be emitted.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • MAX_LAST_UPDATED_NETWORK_HEIGHT_INTERVAL

      public static final long MAX_LAST_UPDATED_NETWORK_HEIGHT_INTERVAL
      The amount of seconds to permit not having fetched a new network height from the daemon before emitting 'deadnode'.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • MAX_LAST_UPDATED_LOCAL_HEIGHT_INTERVAL

      public static final long MAX_LAST_UPDATED_LOCAL_HEIGHT_INTERVAL
      The amount of seconds to permit not having fetched a new local height from the daemon before emitting 'deadnode'.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values
